FuncDef:
The sr-te-policy delete-delay command configures a delay in deleting the segment lists of SR-MPLS TE Policies.
The undo sr-te-policy delete-delay command deletes a delay in deleting the segment lists of SR-MPLS TE Policies.
By default, the delay in deleting the segment lists of SR-MPLS TE Policies is 20000 ms.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a delay in deleting the segment lists of SR-MPLS TE Policies.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 600000, in milliseconds.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To configure a delay in deleting the up segment lists, including backup segment lists, of SR-MPLS TE Policies, run the sr-te-policy delete-delay command. If an SR-MPLS TE Policy has a segment list with a higher preference, a segment list switchover may be performed. In this case, the original segment list that is up can still be used and is deleted only when the delay specified using delete-delay-value expires. This prevents traffic interruptions during the segment list switchover.
Precautions
The sr-te-policy delete-delay command configuration takes effect only for up segment lists in SR-MPLS TE Policies. If seamless bidirectional forwarding detection (SBFD) detects a segment list fault or does not obtain the segment list status, the segment list is considered invalid and then immediately deleted without any delay.
